title: Mohsin Naqvi orders improved coordination among departments
content:
ISLAMABAD, Jul 18 (APP): Federal Interior Minister Mohsin Naqvi has directed all departments under the Ministry of Interior to improve coordination for better service delivery and performance.
Chairing a high-level meeting in Islamabad, the minister said there is a serious lack of coordination among the ministry’s subordinate institutions, which must be addressed on an emergency basis.
He asked all departments to submit proposals within three days suggesting changes to rules and other necessary recommendations.
A comprehensive plan is to be finalized and presented by the Federal Secretary of the Interior.
Naqvi emphasized the need for teamwork and stronger cooperation between departments. “We need to fully benefit from each other’s strengths to improve institutional performance,” he said.
The meeting was attended by Minister of State for Interior Talal Chaudhry, senior ministry officials, and heads of various departments including FIA, NADRA, Islamabad Police, Passport and Immigration, Cyber Crime Investigation, and others.
The minister said that better coordination will ultimately benefit the public and ensure more efficient service delivery.
